com.kuka.connectivity.fri
Class FRIConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  com.kuka.connectivity.fri.FRIConfiguration

public final class FRIConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object

Provides configuration information about the KUKA FRI channel.

In detail, it allows to configure connection specific information of the KUKA Fast Robot Interface, as

  • Connection specific data: FRI remote host, FRI portID(s)
    Note: FRI remote utilizes UDP datagram socket technology. Make sure, that your network topology (firewall, network services) does not collide with the FRI channel.
  • Cyclic timing: Send and receive

See Also:
createRemoteConfiguration(Device,String), FRISession

Method Detail

createRemoteConfiguration

public static FRIConfiguration createRemoteConfiguration(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.deviceModel.Device device,
                                                         java.lang.String hostName)
Creates a FRI channel for usage of UDP from the KUKA controller to a remote system.

The FRI channel is configured by the robot device and the hostname of the remote system. All other configuration data is chosen by default and can be modified by the setters. The settings performed within this context will become active on a subsequent opening of the FRI channel, performed by FRISession.FRISession(FRIConfiguration)

Default values are:

  • Port ID = 30200
  • sendPeriod = 10 [ms]
  • receiveMultiplier = 1
To change defaults, use the corresponding setters:
setPortOnRemote(int), setPortOnController(int), setSendPeriodMilliSec(int), setReceiveMultiplier(int)

Recommendation: Especially for high-speed connections (1..5msec) it is highly preferable to use point-to-point Ethernet connection. In this case it is highly recommended to use the IP-address directly to avoid ambiguities of automatic host to IP-address resolution.

Note: The FRI channel utilizes UDP technology. The port ID is set by setPortOnRemote(int). This value defaults automatically to both ends of the FRI channel, which is the preferable topology. If required by application infrastructure, the port IDs can be chosen to be of different IDs on both ends of the FRI channel. In this case, the controllers side port ID is set by setPortOnController(int).

Parameters:
device - the device which should be addressed with the FRI messages
hostName - the target host or PC-Name of the remote system, with an ipv4 network address.
Returns:
A new created instance of FRIConfiguration(com.kuka.roboticsAPI.deviceModel.Device, java.lang.String)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if host name or device is null

setPortOnController

public void setPortOnController(int controllerPortID)
Set the port ID of the socket at the controller side.

Note: Do not change this port ID, unless your application requires different port IDs on both ends of the FRI channel.
For changing the FRI port ID on both sides, it is sufficient to call setPortOnRemote(int).

Values of controllerPortID:

  • "-1" - The configuration of setPortOnRemote(int) is used. This is the default.
  • recommended range of port IDs: 30200 <= controllerPortID < 30210

Parameters:
controllerPortID - the port ID

setPortOnRemote

public void setPortOnRemote(int portID)
Set the port ID of the FRI channel at the remote side.

By default, this port ID is used on both sides of the FRI channel, unless specified otherwise by setPortOnController(int).

Values of portID:

  • default port ID: 30200
  • recommended range of port IDs: 30200 <= portID < 30210
  • Since the FRI channel utilizes UDP as connection layer, make sure, that your network topology (firewall, network services) are chosen accordingly.

Parameters:
portID - the port ID > 0 (also known as UDP port number)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if port <= 0

setSendPeriodMilliSec

public void setSendPeriodMilliSec(int sendPeriod)
Set the value for the send period of the connection from the KUKA controller to the remote side in [ms].

This means, the KUKA controller will send cyclic FRI messages every sendPeriod milliseconds to the remote side.

Parameters:
sendPeriod - the send period in milliseconds, 1 <= sendPeriod <= 100.
Note: The recommended value for good performance should be between 1-5 milliseconds.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - 100 < sendPeriod <= 0
See Also:
getSendPeriodMilliSec()

setReceiveMultiplier

public void setReceiveMultiplier(int receiveMultiplier)
Set the receive multiplier of the cycle time from the remote side to the KUKA controller.

This multiplier defines the value of the receivePeriod which is calculated:
receivePeriod = receiveMultiplier * sendPeriod

The KUKA controller will expect a FRI response message every receivePeriod milliseconds from the remote side.

The receivePeriod has to be within the range of:
1 <= receivePeriod <= 100.

Parameters:
receiveMultiplier - the receive multiplier of the cycle time.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value of the receive multiplier < 0
See Also:
setSendPeriodMilliSec(int)

Get the host´s name of the remote system, to which the FRI messages are sent.

the configured host name of the remote system.

getPortOnController

public int getPortOnController()
Get the port ID on the controller side.

Note: Unless the port ID was not set by setPortOnController(int) , this function will return -1.

Returns:
the port ID on the controller side of the FRI channel or -1 (default)
See Also:
getPortOnRemote(), setPortOnController(int), setPortOnRemote(int)
